00059 #undef _RANDOM_SAMPLE_ERROR_
00060 /// @brief     Find the value for a given precentile, modifying the data is ok.
00061 /// @param     start     beginning iterator
00062 /// @param     stop      end iterator
00063 /// @param     percentage the percentile to find (0-100)
00064 /// @return    the value found
00065 /// @remark Work with the data "in_place" -- we may shuffle
00066 /// the values around as we work. No copy needed.
00067 template <class RAIterator>
00068 typename iterator_traits<RAIterator>::value_type  
00069 percentile_in_place(RAIterator start, RAIterator stop, double percentage) {
00070   // be sure percentage is in range.
00071   assert((0.0<=percentage)&&(percentage<=100.0));
00072   //
00073   double bucket_index = (stop - start - 1)* percentage / 100.0;
00074   return (bucket_index == trunc(bucket_index)?
00075           RandomizedSelect(start, stop, (int) bucket_index):
00076           (RandomizedSelect(start, stop, (int) floor(bucket_index)) +
00077            RandomizedSelect(start, stop, (int) ceil(bucket_index)))/2);
00078 };
00079 
00080 
00081 /// @param     start     beginning iterator
00082 /// @param     stop      end iterator
00083 /// @param     percentage which precentile to return (0-100)
00084 /// @param     sampleSize (optional) size of sample to take from the input data.
00085 /// @brief     Return the value at a given percentile
00086 /// @remark This does not modify the input data.  If the
00087 /// sampleSize is larger than the inputsize, all the input
00088 /// is used.
00089 template <class RAIterator>
00090 typename iterator_traits<RAIterator>::value_type  
00091 percentile(RAIterator start, RAIterator stop, double percentage, size_t sampleSize = ULONG_MAX)
00092 {
00093   vector<typename iterator_traits<RAIterator>::value_type> tmp;
00094 
00095 #ifndef _RANDOM_SAMPLE_COMPILE_ERROR_
00096     // tmp.resize(min(sampleSize, stop - start));   // original
00097     // JHG SIZE_T DEBUG
00098     assert(stop>start);
00099     size_t tmp_size;
00100     tmp_size=stop - start;
00101     tmp_size=min(sampleSize,tmp_size);
00102     // Check for negative values or a truly large allocation 
00103     assert(0<tmp_size);
00104 
00105     // since we shouldnt modify the data, we make a copy.
00106     tmp.resize(tmp_size);
00107     if (sampleSize > tmp_size) { //stop - start) {
00108       copy(start, stop, tmp.begin());
00109     }
00110     else {
00111       random_sample(start, stop, tmp.begin(), tmp.end());
00112     }
00113 #else
00114     tmp.resize(stop - start);
00115     copy(start, stop, tmp.begin());
00116 #endif
00117 
00118     return percentile_in_place(tmp.begin(), tmp.end(), percentage);
00119 }

00121 template <class RAIterator>
00122 class Median: public binary_function<RAIterator, RAIterator, typename iterator_traits<RAIterator>::value_type> {
00123  public:
00124   long sampleSize;
00125   Median(long ss):sampleSize(ss) {};
00126     typename iterator_traits<RAIterator>::value_type
00127       operator()(RAIterator start, RAIterator stop) {
00128       return median(start, stop, sampleSize);
00129     }
00130 };
00131 
00132 template <class RAIterator>
00133 typename iterator_traits<RAIterator>::value_type  
00134 median(RAIterator start, RAIterator stop, size_t sampleSize=ULONG_MAX) 
00135 {
00136   //typename iterator_traits<RAIterator>::difference_type sampleSize = LONG_MAX) {
00137   //printf("MEDIAN: ss=%lu\n",sampleSize); // JHG 
00138   assert(sampleSize>0); // JHG SIZE_T DEBUG
00139   return percentile(start, stop, 50, sampleSize);
00140 }
00141 
00142 template <class RAIterator>
00143 typename iterator_traits<RAIterator>::value_type  
00144 median_in_place(RAIterator start, RAIterator stop) {
00145   return percentile_in_place(start, stop, 50);
00146 }

00148 template <class RAIterator, class LargeNumber = double>
00149 class Average: public binary_function<RAIterator, RAIterator, double> {
00150 public:
00151   double operator()(RAIterator start, RAIterator stop) {
00152     int size = stop - start;
00153     adder<LargeNumber> sum = 
00154       for_each(start, stop, adder<LargeNumber>());
00155     return sum.result/size;
00156   }
00157 };
00158 
00159 template <class RAIterator>
00160 double average(RAIterator start, RAIterator stop) {
00161   return Average<RAIterator, typename iterator_traits<RAIterator>::value_type>()(start,stop);
00162 };
00163 
00164 template <class RAIterator>
00165 double pseudo_median(RAIterator start, RAIterator stop) {
00166   vector<double> averages;
00167   averages.reserve((start-stop)*(start-stop));
00168   for (RAIterator i = start; i!=stop; i++) {
00169     for (RAIterator j = start; j!=stop; j++) {
00170       averages.push_back((*i + *j)/2);
00171     }
00172   }
00173   return median(averages.begin(), averages.end());
00174 };
00175 
00176 template <class RAIterator, class LargeNumber = double>
00177 class Variance: public binary_function<RAIterator, RAIterator, double> {
00178 public:
00179   double operator()(RAIterator start, RAIterator stop) {
00180     int size = stop - start;
00181     square_adder<LargeNumber> square_sum = 
00182       for_each(start, stop, square_adder<LargeNumber>());
00183     double avg = Average<RAIterator, LargeNumber>()(start, stop);
00184     double result = square_sum.result/size - avg * avg;
00185     return (result <= 0 ? 0: result);
00186   }
00187 };
00188 
00189 template<class RAIterator>
00190 double variance (RAIterator start, RAIterator stop) {
00191   return Variance<RAIterator, typename iterator_traits<RAIterator>::value_type>()(start, stop);
00192 }
00193 
00194 template <class RAIterator, class LargeNumber = double>
00195 class UnbiasedVariance: public binary_function<RAIterator, RAIterator, double> {
00196 public:
00197   double operator()(RAIterator start, RAIterator stop) {
00198     int size = stop - start;
00199     return Variance<RAIterator,LargeNumber>()(start, stop) * size / (size - 1);
00200   }
00201 };
00202 
00203 template <class RAIterator>
00204 double unbiased_variance(RAIterator start, RAIterator stop) {
00205   //int size = stop - start;
00206   return UnbiasedVariance<RAIterator, typename iterator_traits<RAIterator>::value_type>()(start, stop);
00207 }

00210 template <class RAIterator>
00211 double varcoeff(RAIterator start, RAIterator stop) {
00212   return (stddev(start, stop) / average(start, stop));
00213 }
00214 
00215 template <class RAIterator>
00216 double unbiased_stddev(RAIterator start, RAIterator stop) {
00217   return sqrt(unbiased_variance (start, stop));
00218 }
00219 
00220 template <class RAIterator>
00221 double stddev(RAIterator start, RAIterator stop) {
00222   return sqrt(variance (start, stop));
00223 }
00224 
00225 template <class RAIterator>
00226 typename iterator_traits<RAIterator>::value_type  
00227 interquartile_range(RAIterator start, RAIterator stop, long sampleSize = LONG_MAX) {
00228   return percentile(start, stop, 75, sampleSize) - percentile(start, stop, 25, sampleSize);
00229 }

00231 template <class RAIterator, class LargeNumber = double>
00232 class Covariance: public binary_function<RAIterator, RAIterator, double> {
00233 public:
00234   double operator()(RAIterator start1, RAIterator stop1, RAIterator start2) {
00235     int size = stop1 - start1;
00236     vector <LargeNumber> mult_tmp(size);
00237     transform(start1, stop1, start2, mult_tmp.begin(), multiplies<LargeNumber>());
00238     return Average<typename vector<LargeNumber>::iterator, LargeNumber>()(mult_tmp.begin(), mult_tmp.end()) -  
00239            Average<RAIterator,LargeNumber>()(start1, stop1) * 
00240            Average<RAIterator,LargeNumber>()(start2, start2 + size);
00241   }
00242 };
00243 
00244 template <class RAIterator, class LargeNumber = double>
00245 class UnbiasedCovariance: public binary_function<RAIterator, RAIterator, double> {
00246 public:
00247   double operator()(RAIterator start1, RAIterator stop1, RAIterator start2) {
00248     int size = stop1 - start1;
00249     return Covariance<RAIterator,LargeNumber>()(start1, stop1, start2) * size / (size -1);
00250   }
00251 };
00252 
00253 template <class RAIterator>
00254 double unbiased_covariance(RAIterator start1, RAIterator stop1, RAIterator start2) {
00255   int size = stop1 - start1;  
00256   return (covariance(start1, stop1, start2) * size) /(size - 1);
00257 }
00258 
00259 template <class RAIterator>
00260 double covariance(RAIterator start1, RAIterator stop1, RAIterator start2) {
00261   return Covariance<RAIterator, typename iterator_traits<RAIterator>::value_type>()(start1, stop1, start2);
00262 };
00263 
00264 template <class RAIterator>
00265 double correlation_coeff(RAIterator start1, RAIterator stop1, RAIterator start2) {
00266    return (covariance(start1, stop1, start2)/sqrt(variance(start1, stop1) * variance(start2, start2 + (stop1 - start1))));
00267 };
00268 
00269 template <class RAIterator>
00270 double variation_coeff(RAIterator start, RAIterator stop) {
00271   return stddev(start, stop)/
00272     (DBL_MIN + fabs(average(start,stop)));
00273 }
00274 
00275 template <class RAIterator>
00276 double robust_variation_coeff(RAIterator start, RAIterator stop) {
00277   return interquartile_range(start, stop)/
00278     (DBL_MIN + fabs(median(start,stop)));
00279 }

00281 template <class RAIterator>
00282 RAIterator reproducible_random_sample(RAIterator start, RAIterator  stop,
00283                                       RAIterator out, uint32_t size, int32_t seed=0)
00284 {
00285   // Random number generator can't be seeded with zero, our clue to call time.
00286   if(seed == 0)
00287     seed = (uint32_t) time(NULL);
00288   
00289   uint32_t end = size;
00290   uint32_t index = 0;
00291 
00292   /* Copy initial values. */
00293   for( ; start != stop && index < size; ++index, ++start) 
00294     out[index] = *start;
00295 
00296   /* Give every value a chance to overwrite the previous versions. */
00297   while(start != stop) {
00298     ++end;
00299     uint32_t offset = Util::schrageRandom(&seed) % end;
00300     if (offset < size)
00301       out[offset] = *start;
00302     ++start;
00303   }
00304   
00305   return out + index;
00306 }
